meanings.definition: Having more puddles than something else.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the yard was much puddlier than the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The muddy trail was getting puddlier with each step.
meanings.sent3: The puddlier playground made it challenging for the kids to play hopscotch.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like puddlier pools of water, reflecting the stormy sky above.
meanings.sent5: The puddlier road was a nightmare to navigate in the dark.

meanings.sent1: This soup is puddlier than the one we had yesterday.
meanings.sent2: The soil in the garden felt puddlier after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The cake turned out puddlier than expected, but it was still delicious.
meanings.sent4: His voice was like a puddlier version of his usual cheerful self.
meanings.sent5: The paint on the wall looked even puddlier in the dim light of the room.

meanings.definition: In a manner resembling a puddle.
meanings.sent1: She walked puddlier than usual, trying to avoid the wet patches.
meanings.sent2: The dog shook itself off, scattering water puddlier around the room.
meanings.sent3: He danced puddlier than anyone else at the party, causing laughter all around.
meanings.sent4: The music flowed through the room, filling the space puddlier than before.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted the scene with colors blending together puddlier than a watercolor masterpiece.
